Daniel Grof

@Citron
@Citron
 6 hours ago
I am really apalled by the way BGG is mishandling the situation here.
The ratings war undermine credibilty of the whole system and I think this shows, that it is high time to have a serious discussion on review bombing/bumping
The forums are a mess full of hatred and bile, where both sides fight for their truths. Nothing is being solved, no new arguments added, both sides diging themselves deeper in their trenches with each post...
Wouldn't it be more sensible to call for a ceasefire, to let the emotions cool down for a bit a and then perhaps return to a more civilized discussion on ethics and business, authors and their work, minorities rights and how to defend/promote them etc.?

Andrew

@Traefik

 6 hours ago (edited)
It's hard to get a discussion when moderators on this forum have repeatedly banned people for supporting side they don't align with.
In many threads you will see posts removed and users banned notification. There have been may people reporting outside of BGG that their accounts have been locked or deleted after posting reviews on the games simply because they again didn't align with expectations of moderators.

The scales don't seem to feel balanced and to make it right they would have to stop allowing people to review and post on forums for games that have some social stigma attached to it.
ATM it seems fine to jump on bandwagon of boycott but the moment you voice a dissenting tone you do get in trouble.
So the best you can do is just ignore forums and reviews

@Brunop

4 hours ago
David Bimka @Tracystiger
Transgender women are women. There is no inherent biological female sex. What is it that you don't understand. This is pretty basic science. Biological sex isn’t a simple binary, its bimodal—it’s a complex combination of chromosomes, hormones, gonads, and genitalia, each developing at different stages and sometimes diverging from typical patterns. And that is just one aspect, another is neurological.

Labels like “male” and “female” are social constructs designed to generalize biological traits, but they don’t reflect the full spectrum of human diversity. You are totally not a feminist. You divide deny people their right to self-identification because they don't fall into your rigid and incomplete definition of woman. Feminism at its core fights for equality of all genders and sexes, and for their freedom to define their own identities. JKR is a science denier who spreads hatred and bigotry, but that's hardly surprising from someone who defends slavery in her own books right?
